attributes.action: create a department to encourage the media to desensationalise so called terror attacks.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: For example, more babies under the age of 28 days would have died (according to statistical averages from statitistics.gov.uk) in the month of July 2006 than died from the London 7/7 bombings. Not to belittle either set of tragedies, but the Govt. should encourage media outlets to keep these stories in perspective. Another example, the 30th June attack on Glasgow terminal; the average plumber's white van is probably more dangerous than the supposed "bombs". Even the drivers of the "bomb" didn't get seriously hurt. The same amount of damage done could have been achieved by a 16 year old on an ASBO! The Govt. needs to encourage responsible reporting in this arena, instead of using such reporting as an excuse to push draconian laws and ignore far more deadly societal problems like road deaths and poor health services.
